meanings.sent1: The roller coaster's unexpected jolts made me gasp.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake caused the ground to jolt beneath our feet.
meanings.sent3: The jolts in the road made the car bounce up and down comically.
meanings.sent4: The sudden jolts of lightning lit up the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The jolts of the train were so strong that it felt like being pushed.

meanings.definition: To move with a sudden, sharp movement
meanings.sent1: The horse jolts forward when startled.
meanings.sent2: She jolts awake from a bad dream.
meanings.sent3: The chef jolts the pan to toss the ingredients in the air.
meanings.sent4: The sudden noise jolts the cat out of its nap.
meanings.sent5: The car jolts as it hits a pothole on the road.

meanings.sent1: The unexpected jolt of thunder made me jump.
meanings.sent2: His resignation came as a jolt to the team.
meanings.sent3: The jolt of realizing she forgot her keys made her rush back home.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident was a jolt to the entire community.
meanings.sent5: The jolt of excitement when she won the prize was unforgettable.
